page.title: 19Education in Goudhurst.
page.content: Children can be educated in the village up to the age of eleven. There is a community playgroup which caters for 20 children per session. Mrs. Klopper has run a nursery school with professional teachers for 21 years. They have l6 children per session, 39 on the list now. It is open every morning and two afternoons a week. The primary school takes children from 5 to 11 years old, 107 pupils in four classes with Headmaster and 4 teachers. They are divided into houses for sports and academic pursuits. They have an annual inter-house athleticss day. Football, , netball and rounders are played. The P.T.A. funded a swimming pool. The School has a secretary and kitchen staff who supply dinners to Kilndown School.At 11 years the boys & girls go to Angley School in Cranbrook.
